e4: I would not recommend changing to the new policy immediately because it may inadvertently disadvantage small retail investors who are less likely to understand the change in reporting standards. Instead, I would suggest a gradual implementation of the new policy to allow for education and preparation among all stakeholders, particularly smaller investors.
e5: I would view an ethical reporting policy as transparent, honest, and fair. It should clearly disclose any biases or adjustments made to earnings, ensuring that investors have a complete understanding of the company's financial performance. Additionally, it should prioritize consistency, clarity, and simplicity in communication, avoiding potential misinterpretations that could impact investor decisions. Furthermore, it should take into account the needs and sophistication levels of all investors, including retail investors who may be more vulnerable to market fluctuations.
e6: Yes, I would ask how the company plans to address potential confusion or backlash from retail investors who may be accustomed to the previous policy and could experience financial harm if they adjust their expectations. I would also like clarification on whether any adjustments will be made to support these investors during this transition period.
